snippet: Many patients fear tangling with a litigious doctor, or being blackballed by the profession after a negative review of one of its members.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column elaborates on why there is no widespread online system for reviewing physicians, as there are for restaurants, hotels and other services; contends that many patients are reluctant to provide in-depth reviews of their doctors, largely out of fear that the doctor will find out.
lead_paragraph: Many patients fear tangling with a litigious doctor, or being blackballed by the profession after a negative review of one of its members.

headline.print_headline: The Web Is Awash in Reviews, but Not for Doctors. Here’s Why.
headline.seo: Why the Web Lacks Authoritative Reviews of Doctors
headline.main: The Web Is Awash in Reviews, but Not for Doctors. Here’s Why.
